description: The HITRUST CSF (created to stand for Common Security Framework) is a prescriptive set of controls that meet the requirements of multiple regulations and standards. The framework provides a way to comply with ISO/IEC 27000-series and HIPAA standards.HITRUST is led by a management team and governed by an Executive Council made up of leaders from across a variety of industry. These leaders represent the governance of the organization, but other founders also comprise the leadership to ensure the framework meets the short- and long-term needs of the entire industry.
name: OSRS-HITRUST-CSF

values.description: Test place holder
A management framework to initiate and control the implementation and operation of information security within the organization is established.
Employees and contractors understand their responsibilities and are suitable for the roles for which they are considered.
Employees and contractors are aware of and fulfil their information security responsibilities.
The organization's interests are protected during the process of changing or terminating employment.
Organizational assets are identified and appropriate protection responsibilities are defined.
Information receives an appropriate level of protection in accordance with its importance to the organization.
The unauthorized disclosure, modification, removal or destruction of information stored on media is prevented.
Access to information and information processing facilities is limited.
User access is authorized and unauthorized access to systems and services is prevented.
Users are accountable for safeguarding their authentication information.
Unauthorized access to systems and applications is prevented.
Cryptography is properly and effectively used to protect the confidentiality, authenticity and/or integrity of information.
Unauthorized physical access, damage and interference to the organization's information and information processing facilities is prevented.
Loss, damage, theft or compromise of assets and interruption to the organization's operations is prevented.
Correct and secure operations of information processing facilities is ensured.
Information and information processing facilities are protected against malware.
Protections against loss of data are implemented.
Events are recorded and evidence is generated.
The integrity of operational systems is ensured.
The exploitation of technical vulnerabilities is prevented.
The impact of audit activities on operational systems is minimized.
To ensure the protection of information in networks and its supporting information processing facilities.
The security of information transferred within an organization and with any external entity is maintained.
Security is an integral part of information systems--including those providing services over public networks--across the entire system lifecycle.
Information security is designed and implemented within the development lifecycle of information systems.
Data used for testing is protected.
Errors, loss, unauthorized modification or misuse of information in applications is prevented.
Assets accessible by suppliers are protected.
An agreed level of information security and service delivery is maintained in line with supplier agreements.
A consistent and effective approach to the management of information security incidents, including communication on security events and weaknesses is implemented.
Information security continuity is embedded in the organization's business continuity management systems.
Availability of information processing facilities is ensured.
Breaches of legal, statutory, regulatory or contractual obligations related to information security and of any security requirements are avoided.
Information security is implemented and operated in accordance with the organizational policies and procedures.
Policies, procedures, and technologies that directly affect data subjects and/or their PII are open and transparent.
Data subjects are provided a reasonable opportunity and capability to access and review their PII and to challenge its accuracy and completeness.
The authorities which permit the collection of PII and specifically the purpose(s) for which the PII is intended to be used are articulated.
Only PII that is directly relevant and necessary to accomplish the specified purpose(s) is collected.
PII is used solely for the purpose(s) specified in the privacy notice and only for a purpose that is compatible with the purpose for which the PII was collected.
PII is relevant to the purposes for which they are to be used, and, to the extent necessary for those purposes, is accurate, complete and kept up-to-date.
The organization is accountable for complying with applicable privacy protection requirements.
The security of teleworking and use of mobile devices is ensured.
